intro: Isoloma breviflorum, commonly known as the short-flowered isoloma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Isoloma breviflorum produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months.
